DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Malignant Neoplasm Mucin Cellular Secretion Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/not determined indicator whether a tumor of the colon or rectum composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues, produces or secretes mucin, an albuminoid substance containing mucopolysaccharides and protein which is contained in mucus, and gives to the latter secretion its peculiar ropy character.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Colorectal Malignant Neoplasm Mucin Cellular Secretion Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a tumor of the colon or rectum composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues, that produces or secretes mucin, an albuminoid substance containing mucopolysaccharides and protein which is contained in mucus, and gives to the latter secretion its peculiar ropy character.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ko-lo-REK-tul) Having to do with the colon or the rectum.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: An albuminoid substance containing mucopolysaccharides and protein which is contained in mucus, and gives to the latter secretion its peculiar ropy character. It is found in all the secretions from mucous glands, and also between the fibres of connective tissue, as in tendons.:Production by a cell or aggregation of cells (a gland) of a physiologically active substance and its movement out of the cell or organ in which it is formed.  Discharge across the cell membrane, into the intracellular space or ducts, of endogenous substances resulting from the activity of intact cells of glands, tissues, or organs.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: An albuminoid substance containing mucopolysaccharides and protein which is contained in mucus, and gives to the latter secretion its peculiar ropy character. It is found in all the secretions from mucous glands, and also between the fibres of connective tissue, as in tendons.

Production by a cell or aggregation of cells (a gland) of a physiologically active substance and its movement out of the cell or organ in which it is formed.  Discharge across the cell membrane, into the intracellular space or ducts, of endogenous substances resulting from the activity of intact cells of glands, tissues, or organs.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/not determined indicator.._A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown._A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not established beyond doubt; still undecided or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Not established beyond doubt; still undecided or unknown.
